text:
Hops. Grain. Cloudy pale gold. Bright white thick foamy head. Slow fade. Lots of suds on the glass. Light. Crisp. Hoppy. Grainy. Nice easy drinker. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a murky golden with a sudsy white head. The head fades very quickly. Mildly tart nose. The mouthfeel is soft, then faintly astringent, then becoming more soft and wet. Bready and faintly spicy flavors.
Tap. Clear gold color, white foamy head. Grainy aroma, bread with some light fruit. Sweet flavor, malty grain, caramel notes and sugar.

Pours a mostly clear, golden color. About two fingers initial white head. Pretty good retention, some lacing.Aroma is biscuity. Grassy and wet hay.Taste is malty and slightly bitter. Tobacco. Biscuity, Tobacco.Mouthfeel is light. Smooth, crisp, dry. Tobacco. Dank hops.Overall, this is an odd one. I like it, but it has no real goal. I dont know if I would recommend it, but I enjoy it enough that I would buy it again.
Gold pour, pancake white head. Nose is medium roasted grain. Leans sweet. Middle is sweet malt, little apple, little pear. Finish dries to a nice crispness.
12 oz can. Clear golden appearance with an average white head. Aroma is of corn Chex, light pear, grainy, and light herbal notes. Taste is of apple, grain, corn flakes, and some earthy herbal notes.
Pours a clear yellow golden color with white head. Cereal grains, biscuit, grass, and some hay on the nose; follows onto the palate. Light bodied. Finishes with more cereal and biscuity notes.

Can, advance sample. Pours a very clear dark gold with a shallow lacy white head; its a product photographers dream beer. Nose is lemon, tangerine, honey, and biscuity malt. On the tongue, it starts out sweet, but not cloyingly so -- then weighs in with a substantial, weighty body with notes of honey, filbert, and biscuit. I even pick up a little baking spice. This is a lager with gravitas, but it remains refreshing and clean. The mouthfeel is beautiful. Some stone fruit on the finish. Well done.

Really great pale lager! .. Pours a dark gold .. Foam is done very well .. Crushable stuff, mild wheat, hay, and crisp straw .. Solid feel, I liked this! .. . . Fuckin jammed those bros and their Lexus, straight up!

Pleasant light lager. Faint aroma of pale/Pilsner malt. Color of ginger ale with a minimal head. Medium weight. Nice flavor of malt with a touch of lager yeast and a woodsy essence. Good with chicken tacos.
